item.title: Real-time Sentiment Analysis of Video Feed
item.description:
Details

This project was done as part of the course CS771A: Introduction to Machine Learning, in the Fall ‘17 term at IIT Kanpur under Prof. Purushottam Kar, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kanpur.

Abstract

The project aimed at developing a user-end application to get time-mapped viewer sentiment while watching a video. The input will be the real time viewer’s webcam feed while watching the video and the output will be an emotion specified at regular time intervals throughout the video. The following set of six emotions were considered in the application: {Neutral, Happy, Sad, Angry, Surprised, Fearful}

item.title: Humanoid Robotics Project
item.description:
Location

This project was taken as part of the Robotics club at IIT Kanpur during my first two years at IIT Kanpur.

Details

  • Implemented various algorithms such as Line Following, Object Detection and Object Tracking using OpenCV C++.
  • Implemented the Speech Recognition, Chat-bot and the Integration System modules for the project HURO in the SnT Summer Camp 2016.
  • Actively worked with team on Computer Vision problem statements required for participation in the competition HuroCup Fira, a robotic game and robotics benchmark problem for humanoid robots.
  • Implemented Histogram Backprojection algorithm using OpenCV for improving object detection in a camera feed.
